query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
1 Nel mezzo del cammin di nostra vita 2 mi ritrovai per una selva oscura, 3 ché la diritta via era smarrita.
query.result: 1 In the middle of the journey of our life 2 I found myself within a dark wood, 3 for the straightforward pathway had been lost.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
4 Ahi quanto a dir qual era è cosa dura 5 esta selva selvaggia e aspra e forte 6 che nel pensier rinova la paura!
7 Tant’ è amara che poco è più morte; 8 ma per trattar del ben ch’i’ vi trovai, 9 dirò de l’altre cose ch’i’ v’ho scorte.
query.result:
4 Ah, how hard it is to tell what it was like, 5 this wild, savage and rough wood, 6 which in my mind renews the fear!
7 It is so bitter that death is hardly more so, 8 but to treat of the good that I found there, 9 I will tell of the other things that I perceived there.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
10 Io non so ben ridir com’ i’ v’intrai, 11 tant’ era pien di sonno a quel punto 12 che la verace via abbandonai.
query.result: 10 I do not know well how I entered it, 11 so full of sleep was I at that point 12 that I abandoned the true way.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
13 Ma poi ch’i’ fui al piè d’un colle giunto, 14 là dove terminava quella valle 15 che m’avea di paura il cor compunto,
16 guardai in alto e vidi le sue spalle 17 vestite già de’ raggi del pianeta 18 che mena dritto altrui per ogne calle.
query.result:
13 But after I had reached the foot of a hill, 14 where that valley ended 15 which had filled my heart with fear,
16 I looked up and saw its shoulders 17 already clothed with the rays of the planet 18 that leads one straight on every path.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
19 Allor fu la paura un poco queta, 20 che nel lago del cor m’era durata 21 la notte ch’i’ passai con tanta pieta.
query.result: 19 Then the fear was somewhat quieted, 20 which had lasted in the lake of my heart 21 the night that I passed with so much pity.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
22 E come quei che con lena affannata, 23 uscito fuor del pelago a la riva, 24 si volge a l’acqua perigliosa e guata,
25 così l’animo mio, ch’ancor fuggiva, 26 si volse a retro a rimirar lo passo 27 che non lasciò già mai persona viva.
query.result:
22 And like he who with labored breath, 23 having emerged from the sea to the shore, 24 turns to the perilous water and gazes,
25 so my soul, which was still fleeing, 26 turned back to look at the pass 27 that no living person ever left.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
28 Poi ch’èi posato un poco il corpo lasso, 29 ripresi via per la piaggia diserta, 30 sì che ’l piè fermo sempre era ’l più basso.
query.result: 28 After I had rested my weary body a little, 29 I resumed my way through the deserted hillside, 30 so that the firm foot was always the lower one.

31 And behold, almost at the beginning of the steep ascent, 32 a she-panther, light-footed and very swift, 33 covered with a spotted pelt;
34 and it did not depart from before my face, 35 rather it hindered my path so much 36 that I was about to turn back many times.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
37 Temp’ era dal principio del mattino, 38 e ’l sol montava ’n sù con quelle stelle 39 ch’eran con lui quando l’amor divino
40 mosse di prima quelle cose belle; 41 sì ch’a bene sperar m’era cagione 42 di quella fiera a la gaetta pelle
43 l’ora del tempo e la dolce stagione; 44 ma non sì che paura non mi desse 45 la vista che m’apparve d’un leone.

Please translate literally into English.
46 Questi parea che contra me venisse 47 con la test’ alta e con rabbiosa fame, 48 sì che parea che l’aere ne tremesse.
query.result: 46 This one seemed to be coming toward me 47 with its head held high and with raging hunger, 48 so that it seemed the air trembled from it.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
49 Ed una lupa, che di tutte brame 50 sembiava carca ne la sua magrezza, 51 e molte genti fé già viver grame,
52 questa mi porse tanto di gravezza 53 con la paura ch’uscia di sua vista, 54 ch’io perdei la speranza de l’altezza.
query.result:
49 And a she-wolf, who seemed laden with all cravings 50 in her leanness, 51 and had already made many people live in misery,
52 this one caused me so much distress 53 with the fear that issued from her sight, 54 that I lost hope of reaching the height.

55 And just as he who willingly acquires, 56 and the time comes that makes him lose it, 57 grieves and saddens in all his thoughts;
58 so the pitiless beast made me, 59 which, coming toward me, little by little 60 drove me back to where the sun is silent.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
61 Mentre ch’i’ rovinava in basso loco, 62 dinanzi a li occhi mi si fu offerto 63 chi per lungo silenzio parea fioco.
query.result: 61 While I was falling to a low place, 62 before my eyes there appeared 63 someone who seemed hoarse from long silence.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
64 Quando vidi costui nel gran diserto, 65 «Miserere di me», gridai a lui, 66 «qual che tu sii, od ombra od omo certo!».
query.result: 64 When I saw him in the great desert, 65 "Have mercy on me," I cried to him, 66 "whoever you are, a shade or a real man!"

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
67 Rispuosemi: «Non omo, omo già fui, 68 e li parenti miei furon lombardi, 69 mantoani per patrïa ambedui.
query.result: 67 He replied to me: "Not a man, a man I once was, 68 and my parents were Lombards, 69 both of them Mantuan by birth.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
70 Nacqui sub Iulio, ancor che fosse tardi, 71 e vissi a Roma sotto ’l buono Augusto 72 nel tempo de li dèi falsi e bugiardi.
query.result: 70 I was born under Julius, although it was late, 71 and I lived in Rome under the good Augustus 72 in the time of the false and lying gods.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
73 Poeta fui, e cantai di quel giusto 74 figliuol d’Anchise che venne di Troia, 75 poi che ’l superbo Ilïón fu combusto.
query.result: 73 I was a poet, and I sang of that just 74 son of Anchises who came from Troy, 75 after proud Ilium was burned.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
76 Ma tu perché ritorni a tanta noia? 77 perché non sali il dilettoso monte 78 ch’è principio e cagion di tutta gioia?».
query.result: 76 But why do you return to such distress? 77 Why do you not climb the delightful mountain 78 which is the beginning and cause of all joy?"

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
79 «Or se’ tu quel Virgilio e quella fonte 80 che spandi di parlar sì largo fiume?», 81 rispuos’ io lui con vergognosa fronte.
query.result: 79 "Are you indeed that Virgil, that fountain 80 that pours forth such a broad river of speech?" 81 I replied to him with a shamefaced brow.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
82 «O de li altri poeti onore e lume, 83 vagliami ’l lungo studio e ’l grande amore 84 che m’ha fatto cercar lo tuo volume.
query.result: 82 "O honor and light of the other poets, 83 may the long study and the great love 84 that has made me seek out your book avail me.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
85 Tu se’ lo mio maestro e ’l mio autore, 86 tu se’ solo colui da cu’ io tolsi 87 lo bello stilo che m’ha fatto onore.
query.result: 85 You are my master and my author, 86 you are the only one from whom I took 87 the beautiful style that has done me honor.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
88 Vedi la bestia per cu’ io mi volsi; 89 aiutami da lei, famoso saggio, 90 ch’ella mi fa tremar le vene e i polsi».

Please translate literally into English.
100 Molti son li animali a cui s’ammoglia, 101 e più saranno ancora, infin che ’l veltro 102 verrà, che la farà morir con doglia.
query.result: 100 There are many animals to which it mates, 101 and there will be more still, until the greyhound 102 comes, who will make it die in pain.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
103 Questi non ciberà terra né peltro, 104 ma sapïenza, amore e virtute, 105 e sua nazion sarà tra feltro e feltro.
query.result: 103 This one will not feed on land or pelt, 104 but on wisdom, love, and virtue, 105 and his birthplace will be between felt and felt.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
106 Di quella umile Italia fia salute 107 per cui morì la vergine Cammilla, 108 Eurialo e Turno e Niso di ferute.
query.result: 106 He will be the salvation of that humble Italy 107 for which the virgin Camilla died, 108 and Euryalus and Turnus and Nisus from wounds.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
109 Questi la caccerà per ogne villa, 110 fin che l’avrà rimessa ne lo ’nferno, 111 là onde ’nvidia prima dipartilla.
query.result: 109 He will hunt her through every town, 110 until he has driven her back into Hell, 111 from where envy first released her.

121 To which, if you then wish to ascend, 122 there will be a soul more worthy than I for that: 123 I will leave you with her when I depart;
124 for that emperor who reigns up there, 125 because I was rebellious to his law, 126 does not want anyone to come to his city through me.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
127 In tutte parti impera e quivi regge; 128 quivi è la sua città e l’alto seggio: 129 oh felice colui cu’ ivi elegge!».

Please translate literally into English.
130 E io a lui: «Poeta, io ti richeggio 131 per quello Dio che tu non conoscesti, 132 acciò ch’io fugga questo male e peggio,
133 che tu mi meni là dov’ or dicesti, 134 sì ch’io veggia la porta di san Pietro 135 e color cui tu fai cotanto mesti».
query.result:
130 And I to him: "Poet, I beg you 131 by that God whom you did not know, 132 so that I may escape this evil and worse,
133 that you lead me where you just said, 134 so that I may see the gate of Saint Peter 135 and those whom you make so sorrowful."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
136 Allor si mosse, e io li tenni dietro.
query.result: 136 Then he moved, and I followed him.
